name: places/ChIJTTUIoYVYwokRtKkz4Qb41wc
formattedAddress: 127 W 83rd St, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 127 W 83rd St, New York, NY 10024, USA

originalText.text: Coming here is always difficult and unpleasant. I’m here now and there is a long line that is barely moving because there’s only one retail service window open. Just mailing a package can be a 20-40 minute affair here. And the people working here tend to be unfriendly and unhelpful. An employee here just said they are severely understaffed. It’s not the fault of the staff. It’s like the city has just given in on providing an efficient postal service.

originalText.text:
Rude and nasty old lady. Caused my live animal to not be able to be picked up twice. Incompetent at her job and very unprofessional.

That short man with the dirty long hair behind her is terrible also. As you can see he’s a drama queen. This idiot even knew what type of animal I was receiving. He’s nosey and doesn’t help customers, but walks around sticking his nose in everyone’s business.

originalText.text: They ran out of passport applications. They were supposed to have walk in appointments but when we arrived they didn't have any. Even though they agreed to try and fit us in the woman who was helping me asked me multiple times if I had the other parent with me not if I had a notarized form or if there was another parent. I am a solo parent by choice so there is no other parent and this was annoying that she asked so many times. She then proceeded to give me the absentee parent form which I am not required to have. She then yelled that I was filling in the blue application instead of the gold for children under 16 and yelled that I was using the wrong color pen. There were none I could see. She went to look for one for me and didn't return for 10 mins so I left. This is the 2nd post office I have tried to get my sons passport done at. I understand why people go to private agencies. Beyond frustrating.

Beyond frustrating.

originalText.text:
I went to submit my daughters passport application and arrived 5 minutes after my scheduled time which was within the 15 minute grace period. Someone was ahead of us submitting their passport application. We were told to go to the first window and wait behind the black line. There was a young woman who wears glasses and a long weave. She happily helped the family before us. (Who was not of color, i hope i am wrong about pointing this out because the way she treated that family was completely different as to how we were treated.) She really appears to dislike her job and seems to display her unhappiness.  She’s not pleasant or professional and was rude with an attitude.

My opinion is she doesn’t want to be there. When I walked up to the window. She said what time did you get here. I said 5 minutes after my scheduled time slot.  She cut me short and went over to speak to a coworker.  Her coworker motioned for her to help me but she refused.  She came back to the window and told me to step aside and go to the next window.

She should not have a job working with the public. I waited for quit awhile and finally an older woman with short hair and glasses named Beatrice, said I will be right with you I just have to set up. The experience with her processing the passport was quick, easy and pleasant.

The reason I gave a one star is because the first lady was a terrible representative of the U.S. Postal service.  Thanks to Beatrice for saving the day”. If you have no other choice but to go to this location avoid that rude young woman at all cost if you want to have a good postal service experience.”

originalText.text: Mr Luna Lake, Has repeatedly bullied and harassed every employee he has encountered. His reviews have brought harm to many hard working employees. Read his reviews and you will see his tendency towards verbal abuse and hatred which runs through all his reviews. This man deserves no credibility.  He despises everyone.
